triples.name: Twitter
triples.relevance: Twitter is the primary social media platform from which the study collected over 250,000 tweets for analyzing political communication networks.

triples.name: Cluster analysis
triples.relevance: Cluster analysis algorithms are used to identify and analyze the partitioned structure of political communication networks.

triples.name: Social network analysis
triples.relevance: Social network analysis provides the theoretical framework and techniques for examining the topology and connectivity of retweet and mention networks.

triples.name: Tweet (social media)
triples.relevance: Tweets and the mechanisms for sharing them (retweets, mentions) are the fundamental data units analyzed in this study.

triples.name: Public sphere
triples.relevance: The study investigates how social media shape the networked public sphere and facilitate or hinder communication between ideologically-opposed communities.

triples.name: Political polarization
triples.relevance: The paper proposes novel empirical analysis showing how political polarization manifests as highly segregated partisan structure in social media retweet networks.

triples.name: 2010 United States elections
triples.relevance: The 2010 U.S. congressional midterm elections provide the temporal and political context for the data collection period of six weeks.
